result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Sagar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but Court Orders he is not eligible for the program until he has served 24 months of his confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid directly to the Clerk of Court, 811 Harding Street, Waupaca WI  54981.

Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with any co-defendants.
Defendant to have no contact with known drug users or drug dealers.
Defendant shall maintain employment or actively seek employment by providing documentation of at least 10 applications submitted weekly until employment can be obtained.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol.  Only consume prescription medication in the manner and dosage prescribed.
Defendant shall obtain a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations including counseling and taking medications as prescribed.
Defendant shall successfully complete AODA and CGIP assessments and follow through with any and all recommendations.
Defendant shall attend support meetings.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court orders:
10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of extended supervision.
Defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program, but Court orders he is not eligible for the program until he has served 24 months of his confinement.
Conditions of extended supervision.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with any co-defendants.
Defendant shall have no contact with known drug users or drug dealers.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol.  Only consume prescription medication in the manner and dosage prescribe.
Defendant shall obtain a mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations including counseling and taking medications as prescribed.
Defendant shall successfully complete AODA and CGIP assessments and follow through with any and all treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall attend support meetings.
Defendant shall maintain employment or actively seek employment by providing documentation of at least 10 applications submitted weekly until employment can be obtained.
Defendant shall complete programming as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.
Pay costs - directly to Clerk of Courts - due in 60 days.
